casebody.data:
STATE
v.
Cedric Theodis HOBBS, Jr. 263PA18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 21, 2019

John Keating Wiles, Raleigh, Attorney at Law.

Amy Kunstling Irene, Special Deputy Attorney General, For State of North Carolina.

Sterling P. Rozear, Assistant Appellate Defender, For Hobbs, Cedric Theodis (Jr.).

Cedric Theodis Hobbs, Jr., For Hobbs, Cedric Theodis (Jr.).

Donald H. Beskind, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, For Fred T. Korematsu Center for Law and Equality.

David Weiss, Attorney at Law, For Coalition of State and National Criminal Justice and Civil Rights Advocates.

James E. Coleman, Jr., Attorney at Law, For Coalition of State and National Criminal Justice and Civil Rights Advocates.

Elizabeth Hambourger, Attorney at Law, Durham, For Coalition of State and National Criminal Justice and Civil Rights Advocates.

Robert S. Chang, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, For Fred T. Korematsu Center for Law and Equality. Taki V. Flevaris, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, For Fred T. Korematsu Center for Law and Equality.

William R. West, District Attorney, For State of North Carolina.

*93The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File Brief filed on the 21st of August 2019 by State of NC:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 21st of August 2019."

State of NC shall have up to and including the 30th day of September 2019 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court.
